definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.chinese: 優生學具有生物學上的意義。

sentences.english: Politician take no interest in eugenics because the unborn have not vote.
sentences.chinese: 政治家對優生學不感興趣，因爲未出生者並無選舉權。

sentences.english: For a while he also promoted eugenics.
sentences.chinese: 有一陣子，他還提倡優生學。

sentences.english: Not even the Heritage Foundationadvocates a return to such eugenicist policies.
sentences.chinese: 連傳統基金會都不主張回到優生學政策。

sentences.english: Some are raising the specter of eugenics.
sentences.chinese: 一些人還祭出了優生學的幽靈。

sentences.english: Eugenics, so where have we heard that concept before ?
sentences.chinese: 優生學，我們在哪聽到過這個概念？

definition: to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
